channel.title: [PI]Need help with connecting to server![PI]
channel.description:
Okay, my server base is PI when ever i try to connect to my server from my computer, it works fine. when i go on another one of my computers to connect, it always says error connecting to server. I start up uTorrent, then No-Ip, then run my server to get it online. The port check tool that comes with No-Ip dosent show any errors. I am with Sky broadband, and every computer is connected wireless. My firewall is zone alarm, but under Firewall > Zones, I have added the correct host information.
Please Help :cool:

item.title: [PI]Need help with connecting to server![PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Not sure, depends on which client you are using.
But search:

server =

In the server class, you should find an ip like “0.0.0.0”, “127.0.0.1” or some miscellaneous ip.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Need help with connecting to server![PI]
item.dc:creator: @neonscapeftw neonscapeftw
item.description:
@neonscapeftw wrote:

There is no GUI file in my client…
Bit of a dumb question, but do i need a GUI file with a PI base :|?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Need help with connecting to server![PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

You must change the IP in both the client class and GUI class. (Not 100% sure about NEEDING to change in the GUI… But I have anyway?)

Read full topic
